poem:
**The Dance of Policy**

In the paper, the dance begins again—  
U-turns swirling like autumn leaves.  
Promises flicker, warm as the thought  
of comfort, only to wane  
in the dim corridors of power.  
Winter waits outside, indifferent,  
while we huddle by the hearth,  
dreaming of the arrival  
of words turned into heat.
